helpQuickTips: Use time presets to speed up searches.
Switch to exact mode for IDs and error codes.
Pin filters to keep them across searches.

items.q: How do I run my first search?
items.a: 1) Choose a time preset. 2) Enter a keyword. 3) Click Search. Results appear below.

items.q: What does the OS status dot mean?
items.a: Green means OpenSearch reachable. Red means the cluster is down or unreachable.

items.q: How do I clear the app state?
items.a: Click the Clear button to wipe recent searches and bookmarks for this browser.

items.q: How do I change the time range?
items.a: Pick a preset (Last 15 mins, Today, Last 7 days) or choose Custom to set exact dates. Example: set Custom from 2026-01-01 00:00 to 2026-01-07 23:59.

items.q: How do I search a phrase?
items.a: Wrap the phrase in quotes. Example: "payment failed".

items.q: How do I combine terms?
items.a: Use AND/OR/NOT and parentheses. Example: (error OR timeout) AND service:api.

items.q: How do I choose an index pattern?
items.a: Use the Index Pattern dropdown at the top. Example: select "vector-*".

items.q: What does "Remember my index" do?
items.a: It saves your selected index pattern in this browser for future visits. Example: keep "app-logs-*".

items.q: Why is my index missing?
items.a: It may be restricted by team/user access. Ask an admin to grant access.

items.q: What is Relevant mode?
items.a: It uses broader matching and is good for exploratory searches. Example: "timeout" to find related logs.

items.q: What is Exact mode?
items.a: It matches more strictly and is ideal for IDs, error codes, and exact phrases. Example: request_id:abc123.

items.q: How do I switch modes?
items.a: Use the mode toggle near the search controls.

items.q: How do I add a filter with Query Builder?
items.a: Pick a field, choose an operator, enter a value, then add the chip. Example: level is error.

items.q: How do I combine multiple filters?
items.a: Add multiple chips; they are combined with AND by default. Example: level=error AND service=payments.

items.q: How do I remove a chip?
items.a: Click the “x” on the chip.

items.q: How do I filter by a field value?
items.a: Open Field Explorer, click a value to add a filter. Example: service=auth.

items.q: What are pinned filters?
items.a: Pinned filters stay active across searches until you clear them. Example: keep env=prod pinned.

items.q: How do I exclude a value?
items.a: Use NOT in the query. Example: NOT level:info.

items.q: How do I switch between message and full JSON?
items.a: Use the “Show full JSON / Show message only” toggle above results.

items.q: How do I browse pages?
items.a: Use pagination controls at the bottom of the results list. Example: go to page 2 to view older hits.

items.q: Why do I see “No message provided”?
items.a: Some logs don’t have a message field; try full JSON view.

items.q: What are highlight rules?
items.a: They color-code results based on rules like response=500 or request contains /login.

items.q: Can I change highlight rules?
items.a: Admins manage highlight rules in Admin → App Configuration.

items.q: How do I export results?
items.a: Click Export, choose JSON or CSV, confirm the size estimate, then download. Example: export last 15 mins as CSV.

items.q: Why is export disabled?
items.a: Exports can be disabled by your team’s feature toggles.

items.q: Why is export limited?
items.a: Admins set a maximum export size to protect cluster performance.

items.q: How do I save a bookmark?
items.a: Run a search, then click Save Bookmark and give it a name. Example: "Payments 5xx".

items.q: What are team bookmarks?
items.a: Shared bookmarks visible to your team (if enabled).

items.q: How do I re-run a recent search?
items.a: Click it in the Recent Searches list. Example: click "timeout AND service:api".

items.q: How do I switch dark mode?
items.a: Click the moon/sun icon in the header.

items.q: What is the clock showing?
items.a: It displays server-synced time to align with log timestamps. Example: 14:05 UTC.

items.q: What are custom links?
items.a: Admin-provided shortcuts shown below the header for quick access. Example: link to dashboards.

items.q: Can I add my own links?
items.a: Only admins can manage custom links for the team.
